text: Step up your Easter game with this fun and challenging quest for the children.
Assorted coloured construction or art paper
Assorted Easter decorations (Stickers, stamps, pom poms etc)
Download an egg or bunny template.  Mix shapes to make an even bigger surprise!

Cut your template to make a stencil.  Trace your stencil onto art or construction paper and cut out.  Write a clue for the treasure hunt on each shape and then gently roll the shape into a scroll. Secure with a ribbon or elastic.

Hide treats in the locations revealed by the clues.Clue examples:  1. Peek under the place you lay your head. 2. Run to where the shoes are kept.  3. Inside this box, you find letters. 4. Lift the lid where we cook outside. 5. Look inside your favourite book.
Hang string on a wall and attach the scrolls using a clothes peg.
Let your child pick each clue and send them off to hunt!
Glue your template to thicker card to make it easier to trace around
